pr_title: KOGITO-3681 Fail process compilation when there are processes with sa…

timeline.message: KOGITO-3681 Fail process compilation when there are processes with same id in the project.
KOGITO-3681 Fail process compilation when there are processes with same id in the project.

timeline.bodyText:
Is this even parsable? I mean the process is empty and it is not an adHoc process, so shouldn't it throw an exception during parsing? Or maybe it will throw an exception during execution as it won'ŧ be able to find the start node?
I know it is here just for testing, so just curious :)
timeline.author: MarianMacik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<bpmn2:definitions xmlns:bpmn2="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL" xmlns:bpmndi="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/DI" xmlns:bpsim="http://www.bpsim.org/schemas/1.0" xmlns:drools="http://www.jboss.org/drools" id="_BxAKkfY4EDims_O2rjOXww" exporter="jBPM Process Modeler" exporterVersion="2.0" targetNamespace="http://www.omg.org/bpmn20">
+  <bpmn2:process id="duplicated" drools:packageName="com.example" drools:version="1.0" drools:adHoc="false" name="duplicated-process-id" isExecutable="true" processType="Public"/>

replies.bodyText: good question, this is an empty or default generated process file by the editor. I can say that the workflowprocess instance is parsed but not sure how far it would go in the code gen.
replies.author: cristianonicolai
